data.title: Charles L. (Luke) Phillips
data.text:
Share

http://www.roperandsons.com/obit/charles-l-luke-phillips/

Charles L. (Luke) Phillips, 92, Lincoln, died Tuesday (5-10-11). Born (10-30-18) in Spalding, Nebraska to John and Anna (Krick) Phillips. WWII U.S. Army Veteran. Ret. School Administrator, Arcadia Public Schools. Received his Master’s degree in Education from the University of Nebraska Omaha. Member: St. Teresa’s Catholic Church, American Legion Post #3, Lincoln Senior Bowling Association.

Family members include sons, daughters-in-law, Michael J. and Maggie Phillips, Dubuque, IA, Timothy C. and Michelle Phillips, Bryan N. and Susan Phillips, all of Lincoln; daughters, sons-in-law, Michaela M. and Alfred Getz, Silver City, IA, Christine A. and Donald Van Scyoc, Downingtown, PA, Kathleen M. and John Erickson, Omaha; 20 grandchildren and 1 great granddaughter; sisters, Loraine Cooke, Fernley, NV; sister-in-law, Shirley Phillips, Palm Harbor, FL. Preceded in death by parents, wife Harriett, 2 brothers, 3 sisters.

Rosary: 6:30 p.m. Friday (5-13-11) Roper and Sons Chapel, 4300 ‘O’ Street.

Mass of Christian Burial: 1:00 p.m. Saturday (5-14-11) St. Teresa’s Catholic Church, 735 South 36th Street. Msgr. Joseph Nemec, officiating. 3:30 p.m. burial in Westlawn-Hillcrest Memorial Park, Omaha, NE.

Memorials to the family.

Visitation: 2:00 p.m. – 8:00 p.m. Friday, funeral home.
